creator: White, Thomas, 1830-1888. (author)
description: White, Thomas: 1830-1888. Born and educated in Montreal; journalist; founded and operated Peterborough Review, 1853-1860; founded Hamilton Spectator, 1864; immigration agent in England for Canada, 1869; assumed control of Montreal Gazette, 1870; elected to House of Commons, 1878-1888; Minister of the Interior, 1885-1888 and thus responsible for reorganizing government of North West Territories after the second Riel Rebellion (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // Contents: "Review of the policy of the Conservative party" and "The half-breed question."
subject: Rebellions and Regimental Histories--Saskatchewan Rebellion
